contentrichtext.text: '''Hans Christian von Baeyer''' is a Chancellor Professor of Physics at the [[College of William and Mary]]. His [[book]]s include ''[[Information (book)|Information: The New Language of Science]]'' and ''[[Warmth Disperses and Time Passes: The History of Heat]]''. Von Baeyer was born in 1938. Recipient of the [[Science Journalism Award]] of the [[American Association for the Advancement of Science]] and the [[National Magazine Award]], which cites his "uncommon literary grace".<ref>[http://www.randomhouse.ca/author/results.pperl?authorid=36251 RandomHouse.ca | Author Spotlight: Hans Christian Von Baeyer]</ref><!-- the "uncommon grace" portion comes from the front cover of The Fermi Solution, attributed to NMA Committee --><ref>[http://www.phf.upenn.edu/01-02/vonbaeyer.htm That Relentless Whirligig: What Physics Tells us about Time]</ref> He also received the 2005 [[Gemant Award]] for science writing, for prose "crisp, captivating and illuminating" with "depth, passion and clarity" in the ideas
